post.Title: JavaFX links of the week, November 18
post.Content:
A number of great posts this week! Enjoy! :-)

JavaFX

  • The JavaFX Prague team based have two interesting posts this week. Firstly, they have posted on how to build Open JavaFX for Android, and secondly they have a post on iPack -The iOS Application Packager. For those of  you waiting to see JavaFX on mobile devices I am sure you'll be very interested in these two posts!
  • Speaking of JavaFX on mobile devices, Johan Vos has started a community project to try to pull together all the separate projects being worked on by the community so that peoples time is not wasted duplicating effort.
  • Michael has posted a tutorial explaining how he was able to successfully deploy OpenJFX 8 apps to the Mac App Store.
  • In another post, Michael has posted his Devoxx 2013 materials regarding VPlot & VRL-Studio, which is the software he got into the Mac App Store.
  • Gerrit Grunwald recently presented at Oredev on custom JavaFX controls, and now the video recording of the presentation is available online for your watching pleasure.
  • Jens Deters has a post introducing his new project ‘adm4EE’, which is an open source JavaFX application designed to manage Java EE application servers.
  • The Scene Builder team at Oracle has posted a PaintPicker prototype video that may appear in a future release of Scene Builder.
  • Sean Phillips has posted on 'Dealing with Data with JavaFX Visuals and the NetBeans Platform'.
  • Adam Bien has posted a short video tutorial on data binding, injection and FXML.
  • Pedro Duque Vieira continues with JMetro, this week adding a Metro style for Tooltip.

Swing

  • Dave Gilbert has announced the release of Orson Charts, a (commercial) 3D chart library for the Java platform that only depends on Java2D.

I hope that was useful to everyone! :-) Catch you all again next week!
